44/**
45 * _wait_for - magic (register) wait macro
46 *
47 * Does the right thing for modeset paths when run under kdgb or similar atomic
48 * contexts. Note that it's important that we check the condition again after
49 * having timed out, since the timeout could be due to preemption or similar and
50 * we've never had a chance to check the condition before the timeout.
51 */
52#ifdef __NetBSD__
53#define _wait_for(COND, MS, W) ({ \
54 int ret__ = 0; \
55 if (cold) { \
56 int ms = (MS); \
57 while (!(COND)) { \
58 if (--ms < 0) { \
59 DELAY(1000); \
60 if (!(COND)) \
61 ret__ = -ETIMEDOUT; \
62 break; \
63 } \
64 DELAY(1000); \
65 } \
66 } else { \
67 unsigned long timeout__ = jiffies + msecs_to_jiffies(MS); \
68 while (!(COND)) { \
69 if (time_after(jiffies, timeout__)) { \
70 if (!(COND)) \
71 ret__ = -ETIMEDOUT; \
72 break; \
73 } \
74 if ((W) && drm_can_sleep()) { \
75 msleep(W); \
76 } else { \
77 DELAY(1000); \
78 } \
79 } \
80 } \
81 ret__; \
82})
83#else /* !NetBSD */
84#define _wait_for(COND, MS, W) ({ \
85 unsigned long timeout__ = jiffies + msecs_to_jiffies(MS) + 1; \
86 int ret__ = 0; \
87 while (!(COND)) { \
88 if (time_after(jiffies, timeout__)) { \
89 if (!(COND)) \
90 ret__ = -ETIMEDOUT; \
91 break; \
92 } \
93 if ((W) && drm_can_sleep()) { \
94 usleep_range((W)*1000, (W)*2000); \
95 } else { \
96 cpu_relax(); \
97 } \
98 } \
99 ret__; \
100})
101#endif /* NetBSD */
102
103#define wait_for(COND, MS) _wait_for(COND, MS, 1)
104#define wait_for_atomic(COND, MS) _wait_for(COND, MS, 0)
105#define wait_for_atomic_us(COND, US) _wait_for((COND), \
106 DIV_ROUND_UP((US), 1000), 0)
107
108#define KHz(x) (1000 * (x))
109#define MHz(x) KHz(1000 * (x))
110
111/*
112 * Display related stuff
113 */
114
115/* store information about an Ixxx DVO */
116/* The i830->i865 use multiple DVOs with multiple i2cs */
117/* the i915, i945 have a single sDVO i2c bus - which is different */
118#define MAX_OUTPUTS 6
119/* maximum connectors per crtcs in the mode set */
120
121/* Maximum cursor sizes */
122#define GEN2_CURSOR_WIDTH 64
123#define GEN2_CURSOR_HEIGHT 64
124#define MAX_CURSOR_WIDTH 256
125#define MAX_CURSOR_HEIGHT 256
126
127#define INTEL_I2C_BUS_DVO 1
128#define INTEL_I2C_BUS_SDVO 2
129
130/* these are outputs from the chip - integrated only
131 external chips are via DVO or SDVO output */
132enum intel_output_type {
133 INTEL_OUTPUT_UNUSED = 0,
134 INTEL_OUTPUT_ANALOG = 1,
135 INTEL_OUTPUT_DVO = 2,
136 INTEL_OUTPUT_SDVO = 3,
137 INTEL_OUTPUT_LVDS = 4,
138 INTEL_OUTPUT_TVOUT = 5,
139 INTEL_OUTPUT_HDMI = 6,
140 INTEL_OUTPUT_DISPLAYPORT = 7,
141 INTEL_OUTPUT_EDP = 8,
142 INTEL_OUTPUT_DSI = 9,
143 INTEL_OUTPUT_UNKNOWN = 10,
144 INTEL_OUTPUT_DP_MST = 11,
145};
146
147#define INTEL_DVO_CHIP_NONE 0
148#define INTEL_DVO_CHIP_LVDS 1
149#define INTEL_DVO_CHIP_TMDS 2
150#define INTEL_DVO_CHIP_TVOUT 4
151
152#define INTEL_DSI_VIDEO_MODE 0
153#define INTEL_DSI_COMMAND_MODE 1

155struct intel_framebuffer {
156 struct drm_framebuffer base;
157 struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj;
158};
159
160struct intel_fbdev {
161 struct drm_fb_helper helper;
162 struct intel_framebuffer *fb;
163 struct list_head fbdev_list;
164 struct drm_display_mode *our_mode;
165 int preferred_bpp;
166};
167
168struct intel_encoder {
169 struct drm_encoder base;
170
171 enum intel_output_type type;
172 unsigned int cloneable;
173 void (*hot_plug)(struct intel_encoder *);
174 bool (*compute_config)(struct intel_encoder *,
175 struct intel_crtc_state *);
176 void (*pre_pll_enable)(struct intel_encoder *);
177 void (*pre_enable)(struct intel_encoder *);
178 void (*enable)(struct intel_encoder *);
179 void (*mode_set)(struct intel_encoder *intel_encoder);
180 void (*disable)(struct intel_encoder *);
181 void (*post_disable)(struct intel_encoder *);
182 void (*post_pll_disable)(struct intel_encoder *);
183 /* Read out the current hw state of this connector, returning true if
184 * the encoder is active. If the encoder is enabled it also set the pipe
185 * it is connected to in the pipe parameter. */
186 bool (*get_hw_state)(struct intel_encoder *, enum i915_pipe *pipe);
187 /* Reconstructs the equivalent mode flags for the current hardware
188 * state. This must be called _after_ display->get_pipe_config has
189 * pre-filled the pipe config. Note that intel_encoder->base.crtc must
190 * be set correctly before calling this function. */
191 void (*get_config)(struct intel_encoder *,
192 struct intel_crtc_state *pipe_config);
193 /*
194 * Called during system suspend after all pending requests for the
195 * encoder are flushed (for example for DP AUX transactions) and
196 * device interrupts are disabled.
197 */
198 void (*suspend)(struct intel_encoder *);
199 int crtc_mask;
200 enum hpd_pin hpd_pin;
201};
202
203struct intel_panel {
204 struct drm_display_mode *fixed_mode;
205 struct drm_display_mode *downclock_mode;
206 int fitting_mode;
207
208 /* backlight */
209 struct {
210 bool present;
211 u32 level;
212 u32 min;
213 u32 max;
214 bool enabled;
215 bool combination_mode; /* gen 2/4 only */
216 bool active_low_pwm;
217
218 /* PWM chip */
219 bool util_pin_active_low; /* bxt+ */
220 u8 controller; /* bxt+ only */
221 struct pwm_device *pwm;
222
223 struct backlight_device *device;
224
225 /* Connector and platform specific backlight functions */
226 int (*setup)(struct intel_connector *connector, enum i915_pipe pipe);
227 uint32_t (*get)(struct intel_connector *connector);
228 void (*set)(struct intel_connector *connector, uint32_t level);
229 void (*disable)(struct intel_connector *connector);
230 void (*enable)(struct intel_connector *connector);
231 uint32_t (*hz_to_pwm)(struct intel_connector *connector,
232 uint32_t hz);
233 void (*power)(struct intel_connector *, bool enable);
234 } backlight;
235};
236
237struct intel_connector {
238 struct drm_connector base;
239 /*
240 * The fixed encoder this connector is connected to.
241 */
242 struct intel_encoder *encoder;
243
244 /* Reads out the current hw, returning true if the connector is enabled
245 * and active (i.e. dpms ON state). */
246 bool (*get_hw_state)(struct intel_connector *);
247
248 /*
249 * Removes all interfaces through which the connector is accessible
250 * - like sysfs, debugfs entries -, so that no new operations can be
251 * started on the connector. Also makes sure all currently pending
252 * operations finish before returing.
253 */
254 void (*unregister)(struct intel_connector *);
255
256 /* Panel info for eDP and LVDS */
257 struct intel_panel panel;
258
259 /* Cached EDID for eDP and LVDS. May hold ERR_PTR for invalid EDID. */
260 struct edid *edid;
261 struct edid *detect_edid;
262
263 /* since POLL and HPD connectors may use the same HPD line keep the native
264 state of connector->polled in case hotplug storm detection changes it */
265 u8 polled;
266
267 void *port; /* store this opaque as its illegal to dereference it */
268
269 struct intel_dp *mst_port;
270};
271
272typedef struct dpll {
273 /* given values */
274 int n;
275 int m1, m2;
276 int p1, p2;
277 /* derived values */
278 int dot;
279 int vco;
280 int m;
281 int p;
282} intel_clock_t;

284struct intel_atomic_state {
285 struct drm_atomic_state base;
286
287 unsigned int cdclk;
288 bool dpll_set;
289 struct intel_shared_dpll_config shared_dpll[I915_NUM_PLLS];
290};
291
292struct intel_plane_state {
293 struct drm_plane_state base;
294 struct drm_rect src;
295 struct drm_rect dst;
296 struct drm_rect clip;
297 bool visible;
298
299 /*
300 * scaler_id
301 * = -1 : not using a scaler
302 * >= 0 : using a scalers
303 *
304 * plane requiring a scaler:
305 * - During check_plane, its bit is set in
306 * crtc_state->scaler_state.scaler_users by calling helper function
307 * update_scaler_plane.
308 * - scaler_id indicates the scaler it got assigned.
309 *
310 * plane doesn't require a scaler:
311 * - this can happen when scaling is no more required or plane simply
312 * got disabled.
313 * - During check_plane, corresponding bit is reset in
314 * crtc_state->scaler_state.scaler_users by calling helper function
315 * update_scaler_plane.
316 */
317 int scaler_id;
318
319 struct drm_intel_sprite_colorkey ckey;
320};
321
322struct intel_initial_plane_config {
323 struct intel_framebuffer *fb;
324 unsigned int tiling;
325 int size;
326 u32 base;
327};

329#define SKL_MIN_SRC_W 8
330#define SKL_MAX_SRC_W 4096
331#define SKL_MIN_SRC_H 8
332#define SKL_MAX_SRC_H 4096
333#define SKL_MIN_DST_W 8
334#define SKL_MAX_DST_W 4096
335#define SKL_MIN_DST_H 8
336#define SKL_MAX_DST_H 4096

338struct intel_scaler {
339 int in_use;
340 uint32_t mode;
341};
342
343struct intel_crtc_scaler_state {
344#define SKL_NUM_SCALERS 2
345 struct intel_scaler scalers[SKL_NUM_SCALERS];
346
347 /*
348 * scaler_users: keeps track of users requesting scalers on this crtc.
349 *
350 * If a bit is set, a user is using a scaler.
351 * Here user can be a plane or crtc as defined below:
352 * bits 0-30 - plane (bit position is index from drm_plane_index)
353 * bit 31 - crtc
354 *
355 * Instead of creating a new index to cover planes and crtc, using
356 * existing drm_plane_index for planes which is well less than 31
357 * planes and bit 31 for crtc. This should be fine to cover all
358 * our platforms.
359 *
360 * intel_atomic_setup_scalers will setup available scalers to users
361 * requesting scalers. It will gracefully fail if request exceeds
362 * avilability.
363 */
364#define SKL_CRTC_INDEX 31
365 unsigned scaler_users;
366
367 /* scaler used by crtc for panel fitting purpose */
368 int scaler_id;
369};
370
371/* drm_mode->private_flags */
372#define I915_MODE_FLAG_INHERITED 1
373
374struct intel_crtc_state {
375 struct drm_crtc_state base;
376
377 /**
378 * quirks - bitfield with hw state readout quirks
379 *
380 * For various reasons the hw state readout code might not be able to
381 * completely faithfully read out the current state. These cases are
382 * tracked with quirk flags so that fastboot and state checker can act
383 * accordingly.
384 */
385#define PIPE_CONFIG_QUIRK_MODE_SYNC_FLAGS (1<<0) /* unreliable sync mode.flags */
386 unsigned long quirks;
387
388 bool update_pipe;
389
390 /* Pipe source size (ie. panel fitter input size)
391 * All planes will be positioned inside this space,
392 * and get clipped at the edges. */
393 int pipe_src_w, pipe_src_h;
394
395 /* Whether to set up the PCH/FDI. Note that we never allow sharing
396 * between pch encoders and cpu encoders. */
397 bool has_pch_encoder;
398
399 /* Are we sending infoframes on the attached port */
400 bool has_infoframe;
401
402 /* CPU Transcoder for the pipe. Currently this can only differ from the
403 * pipe on Haswell (where we have a special eDP transcoder). */
404 enum transcoder cpu_transcoder;
405
406 /*
407 * Use reduced/limited/broadcast rbg range, compressing from the full
408 * range fed into the crtcs.
409 */
410 bool limited_color_range;
411
412 /* DP has a bunch of special case unfortunately, so mark the pipe
413 * accordingly. */
414 bool has_dp_encoder;
415
416 /* Whether we should send NULL infoframes. Required for audio. */
417 bool has_hdmi_sink;
418
419 /* Audio enabled on this pipe. Only valid if either has_hdmi_sink or
420 * has_dp_encoder is set. */
421 bool has_audio;
422
423 /*
424 * Enable dithering, used when the selected pipe bpp doesn't match the
425 * plane bpp.
426 */
427 bool dither;
428
429 /* Controls for the clock computation, to override various stages. */
430 bool clock_set;
431
432 /* SDVO TV has a bunch of special case. To make multifunction encoders
433 * work correctly, we need to track this at runtime.*/
434 bool sdvo_tv_clock;
435
436 /*
437 * crtc bandwidth limit, don't increase pipe bpp or clock if not really
438 * required. This is set in the 2nd loop of calling encoder's
439 * ->compute_config if the first pick doesn't work out.
440 */
441 bool bw_constrained;
442
443 /* Settings for the intel dpll used on pretty much everything but
444 * haswell. */
445 struct dpll dpll;
446
447 /* Selected dpll when shared or DPLL_ID_PRIVATE. */
448 enum intel_dpll_id shared_dpll;
449
450 /*
451 * - PORT_CLK_SEL for DDI ports on HSW/BDW.
452 * - enum skl_dpll on SKL
453 */
454 uint32_t ddi_pll_sel;
455
456 /* Actual register state of the dpll, for shared dpll cross-checking. */
457 struct intel_dpll_hw_state dpll_hw_state;
458
459 int pipe_bpp;
460 struct intel_link_m_n dp_m_n;
461
462 /* m2_n2 for eDP downclock */
463 struct intel_link_m_n dp_m2_n2;
464 bool has_drrs;
465
466 /*
467 * Frequence the dpll for the port should run at. Differs from the
468 * adjusted dotclock e.g. for DP or 12bpc hdmi mode. This is also
469 * already multiplied by pixel_multiplier.
470 */
471 int port_clock;
472
473 /* Used by SDVO (and if we ever fix it, HDMI). */
474 unsigned pixel_multiplier;
475
476 uint8_t lane_count;
477
478 /* Panel fitter controls for gen2-gen4 + VLV */
479 struct {
480 u32 control;
481 u32 pgm_ratios;
482 u32 lvds_border_bits;
483 } gmch_pfit;
484
485 /* Panel fitter placement and size for Ironlake+ */
486 struct {
487 u32 pos;
488 u32 size;
489 bool enabled;
490 bool force_thru;
491 } pch_pfit;
492
493 /* FDI configuration, only valid if has_pch_encoder is set. */
494 int fdi_lanes;
495 struct intel_link_m_n fdi_m_n;
496
497 bool ips_enabled;
498
499 bool double_wide;
500
501 bool dp_encoder_is_mst;
502 int pbn;
503
504 struct intel_crtc_scaler_state scaler_state;
505
506 /* w/a for waiting 2 vblanks during crtc enable */
507 enum i915_pipe hsw_workaround_pipe;
508};
509
510struct vlv_wm_state {
511 struct vlv_pipe_wm wm[3];
512 struct vlv_sr_wm sr[3];
513 uint8_t num_active_planes;
514 uint8_t num_levels;
515 uint8_t level;
516 bool cxsr;
517};

519struct intel_pipe_wm {
520 struct intel_wm_level wm[5];
521 uint32_t linetime;
522 bool fbc_wm_enabled;
523 bool pipe_enabled;
524 bool sprites_enabled;
525 bool sprites_scaled;

528struct intel_mmio_flip {
529 struct work_struct work;
530 struct drm_i915_private *i915;
531 struct drm_i915_gem_request *req;
532 struct intel_crtc *crtc;
533};

535struct skl_pipe_wm {
536 struct skl_wm_level wm[8];
537 struct skl_wm_level trans_wm;
538 uint32_t linetime;
539};

541/*
542 * Tracking of operations that need to be performed at the beginning/end of an
543 * atomic commit, outside the atomic section where interrupts are disabled.
544 * These are generally operations that grab mutexes or might otherwise sleep
545 * and thus can't be run with interrupts disabled.
546 */
547struct intel_crtc_atomic_commit {
548 /* Sleepable operations to perform before commit */
549 bool wait_for_flips;
550 bool disable_fbc;
551 bool disable_ips;
552 bool disable_cxsr;
553 bool pre_disable_primary;
554 bool update_wm_pre, update_wm_post;
555 unsigned disabled_planes;
556
557 /* Sleepable operations to perform after commit */
558 unsigned fb_bits;
559 bool wait_vblank;
560 bool update_fbc;
561 bool post_enable_primary;
562 unsigned update_sprite_watermarks;
563};
564
565struct intel_crtc {
566 struct drm_crtc base;
567 enum i915_pipe pipe;
568 enum plane plane;
569 u8 lut_r[256], lut_g[256], lut_b[256];
570 /*
571 * Whether the crtc and the connected output pipeline is active. Implies
572 * that crtc->enabled is set, i.e. the current mode configuration has
573 * some outputs connected to this crtc.
574 */
575 bool active;
576 unsigned long enabled_power_domains;
577 bool lowfreq_avail;
578 struct intel_overlay *overlay;
579 struct intel_unpin_work *unpin_work;
580
581 atomic_t unpin_work_count;
582
583 /* Display surface base address adjustement for pageflips. Note that on
584 * gen4+ this only adjusts up to a tile, offsets within a tile are
585 * handled in the hw itself (with the TILEOFF register). */
586 unsigned long dspaddr_offset;
587 int adjusted_x;
588 int adjusted_y;
589
590 uint32_t cursor_addr;
591 uint32_t cursor_cntl;
592 uint32_t cursor_size;
593 uint32_t cursor_base;
594
595 struct intel_crtc_state *config;
596
597 /* reset counter value when the last flip was submitted */
598 unsigned int reset_counter;
599
600 /* Access to these should be protected by dev_priv->irq_lock. */
601 bool cpu_fifo_underrun_disabled;
602 bool pch_fifo_underrun_disabled;
603
604 /* per-pipe watermark state */
605 struct {
606 /* watermarks currently being used */
607 struct intel_pipe_wm active;
608 /* SKL wm values currently in use */
609 struct skl_pipe_wm skl_active;
610 /* allow CxSR on this pipe */
611 bool cxsr_allowed;
612 } wm;
613
614 int scanline_offset;
615
616 struct {
617 unsigned start_vbl_count;
618 ktime_t start_vbl_time;
619 int min_vbl, max_vbl;
620 int scanline_start;
621 } debug;
622
623 struct intel_crtc_atomic_commit atomic;
624
625 /* scalers available on this crtc */
626 int num_scalers;
627
628 struct vlv_wm_state wm_state;
629};
630
631struct intel_plane_wm_parameters {
632 uint32_t horiz_pixels;
633 uint32_t vert_pixels;
634 /*
635 * For packed pixel formats:
636 * bytes_per_pixel - holds bytes per pixel
637 * For planar pixel formats:
638 * bytes_per_pixel - holds bytes per pixel for uv-plane
639 * y_bytes_per_pixel - holds bytes per pixel for y-plane
640 */
641 uint8_t bytes_per_pixel;
642 uint8_t y_bytes_per_pixel;
643 bool enabled;
644 bool scaled;
645 u64 tiling;
646 unsigned int rotation;
647 uint16_t fifo_size;
648};
649
650struct intel_plane {
651 struct drm_plane base;
652 int plane;
653 enum i915_pipe pipe;
654 bool can_scale;
655 int max_downscale;
656 uint32_t frontbuffer_bit;
657
658 /* Since we need to change the watermarks before/after
659 * enabling/disabling the planes, we need to store the parameters here
660 * as the other pieces of the struct may not reflect the values we want
661 * for the watermark calculations. Currently only Haswell uses this.
662 */
663 struct intel_plane_wm_parameters wm;
664
665 /*
666 * NOTE: Do not place new plane state fields here (e.g., when adding
667 * new plane properties). New runtime state should now be placed in
668 * the intel_plane_state structure and accessed via drm_plane->state.
669 */
670
671 void (*update_plane)(struct drm_plane *plane,
672 struct drm_crtc *crtc,
673 struct drm_framebuffer *fb,
674 int crtc_x, int crtc_y,
675 unsigned int crtc_w, unsigned int crtc_h,
676 uint32_t x, uint32_t y,
677 uint32_t src_w, uint32_t src_h);
678 void (*disable_plane)(struct drm_plane *plane,
679 struct drm_crtc *crtc);
680 int (*check_plane)(struct drm_plane *plane,
681 struct intel_crtc_state *crtc_state,
682 struct intel_plane_state *state);
683 void (*commit_plane)(struct drm_plane *plane,
684 struct intel_plane_state *state);
685};
686
687struct intel_watermark_params {
688 unsigned long fifo_size;
689 unsigned long max_wm;
690 unsigned long default_wm;
691 unsigned long guard_size;
692 unsigned long cacheline_size;
693};

695struct cxsr_latency {
696 int is_desktop;
697 int is_ddr3;
698 unsigned long fsb_freq;
699 unsigned long mem_freq;
700 unsigned long display_sr;
701 unsigned long display_hpll_disable;
702 unsigned long cursor_sr;
703 unsigned long cursor_hpll_disable;
704};

706#define to_intel_atomic_state(x) container_of(x, struct intel_atomic_state, base)
707#define to_intel_crtc(x) container_of(x, struct intel_crtc, base)
708#define to_intel_crtc_state(x) container_of(x, struct intel_crtc_state, base)
709#define to_intel_connector(x) container_of(x, struct intel_connector, base)
710#define to_intel_encoder(x) container_of(x, struct intel_encoder, base)
711#define to_intel_framebuffer(x) container_of(x, struct intel_framebuffer, base)
712#define to_intel_plane(x) container_of(x, struct intel_plane, base)
713#define to_intel_plane_state(x) container_of(x, struct intel_plane_state, base)
714#define intel_fb_obj(x) (x ? to_intel_framebuffer(x)->obj : NULL)

716struct intel_hdmi {
717 u32 hdmi_reg;
718 int ddc_bus;
719 bool limited_color_range;
720 bool color_range_auto;
721 bool has_hdmi_sink;
722 bool has_audio;
723 enum hdmi_force_audio force_audio;
724 bool rgb_quant_range_selectable;
725 enum hdmi_picture_aspect aspect_ratio;
726 struct intel_connector *attached_connector;
727 void (*write_infoframe)(struct drm_encoder *encoder,
728 enum hdmi_infoframe_type type,
729 const void *frame, ssize_t len);
730 void (*set_infoframes)(struct drm_encoder *encoder,
731 bool enable,
732 const struct drm_display_mode *adjusted_mode);
733 bool (*infoframe_enabled)(struct drm_encoder *encoder);
734};
735
736struct intel_dp_mst_encoder;
737#define DP_MAX_DOWNSTREAM_PORTS 0x10
738
739/*
740 * enum link_m_n_set:
741 * When platform provides two set of M_N registers for dp, we can
742 * program them and switch between them incase of DRRS.
743 * But When only one such register is provided, we have to program the
744 * required divider value on that registers itself based on the DRRS state.
745 *
746 * M1_N1 : Program dp_m_n on M1_N1 registers
747 * dp_m2_n2 on M2_N2 registers (If supported)
748 *
749 * M2_N2 : Program dp_m2_n2 on M1_N1 registers
750 * M2_N2 registers are not supported
751 */
752
753enum link_m_n_set {
754 /* Sets the m1_n1 and m2_n2 */
755 M1_N1 = 0,
756 M2_N2
757};
758
759struct sink_crc {
760 bool started;
761 u8 last_crc[6];
762 int last_count;
763};
764
765struct intel_dp {
766 uint32_t output_reg;
767 uint32_t aux_ch_ctl_reg;
768 uint32_t DP;
769 int link_rate;
770 uint8_t lane_count;
771 bool has_audio;
772 enum hdmi_force_audio force_audio;
773 bool limited_color_range;
774 bool color_range_auto;
775 uint8_t dpcd[DP_RECEIVER_CAP_SIZE];
776 uint8_t psr_dpcd[EDP_PSR_RECEIVER_CAP_SIZE];
777 uint8_t downstream_ports[DP_MAX_DOWNSTREAM_PORTS];
778 /* sink rates as reported by DP_SUPPORTED_LINK_RATES */
779 uint8_t num_sink_rates;
780 int sink_rates[DP_MAX_SUPPORTED_RATES];
781 struct sink_crc sink_crc;
782 struct drm_dp_aux aux;
783 uint8_t train_set[4];
784 int panel_power_up_delay;
785 int panel_power_down_delay;
786 int panel_power_cycle_delay;
787 int backlight_on_delay;
788 int backlight_off_delay;
789 struct delayed_work panel_vdd_work;
790 bool want_panel_vdd;
791 unsigned long last_power_cycle;
792 unsigned long last_power_on;
793 unsigned long last_backlight_off;
794
795 struct notifier_block edp_notifier;
796
797 /*
798 * Pipe whose power sequencer is currently locked into
799 * this port. Only relevant on VLV/CHV.
800 */
801 enum i915_pipe pps_pipe;
802 struct edp_power_seq pps_delays;
803
804 bool can_mst; /* this port supports mst */
805 bool is_mst;
806 int active_mst_links;
807 /* connector directly attached - won't be use for modeset in mst world */
808 struct intel_connector *attached_connector;
809
810 /* mst connector list */
811 struct intel_dp_mst_encoder *mst_encoders[I915_MAX_PIPES];
812 struct drm_dp_mst_topology_mgr mst_mgr;
813
814 uint32_t (*get_aux_clock_divider)(struct intel_dp *dp, int index);
815 /*
816 * This function returns the value we have to program the AUX_CTL
817 * register with to kick off an AUX transaction.
818 */
819 uint32_t (*get_aux_send_ctl)(struct intel_dp *dp,
820 bool has_aux_irq,
821 int send_bytes,
822 uint32_t aux_clock_divider);
823
824 /* Displayport compliance testing */
825 unsigned long compliance_test_type;
826 unsigned long compliance_test_data;
827 bool compliance_test_active;
828};
829
830struct intel_digital_port {
831 struct intel_encoder base;
832 enum port port;
833 u32 saved_port_bits;
834 struct intel_dp dp;
835 struct intel_hdmi hdmi;
836 enum irqreturn (*hpd_pulse)(struct intel_digital_port *, bool);
837 bool release_cl2_override;
838};
839
840struct intel_dp_mst_encoder {
841 struct intel_encoder base;
842 enum i915_pipe pipe;
843 struct intel_digital_port *primary;
844 void *port; /* store this opaque as its illegal to dereference it */
845};
846
847static inline enum dpio_channel
848vlv_dport_to_channel(struct intel_digital_port *dport)
849{
850 switch (dport->port) {
851 case PORT_B:
852 case PORT_D:
853 return DPIO_CH0;
854 case PORT_C:
855 return DPIO_CH1;
856 default:
857 BUG();
858 }
859}
860
861static inline enum dpio_phy
862vlv_dport_to_phy(struct intel_digital_port *dport)
863{
864 switch (dport->port) {
865 case PORT_B:
866 case PORT_C:
867 return DPIO_PHY0;
868 case PORT_D:
869 return DPIO_PHY1;
870 default:
871 BUG();
872 }
873}
874
875static inline enum dpio_channel
876vlv_pipe_to_channel(enum i915_pipe pipe)
877{
878 switch (pipe) {
879 case PIPE_A:
880 case PIPE_C:
881 return DPIO_CH0;
882 case PIPE_B:
883 return DPIO_CH1;
884 default:
885 BUG();
886 }
887}
888
889static inline struct drm_crtc *
890intel_get_crtc_for_pipe(struct drm_device *dev, int pipe)
891{
892 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
893 return dev_priv->pipe_to_crtc_mapping[pipe];
894}
895
896static inline struct drm_crtc *
897intel_get_crtc_for_plane(struct drm_device *dev, int plane)
898{
899 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
900 return dev_priv->plane_to_crtc_mapping[plane];
901}

903struct intel_unpin_work {
904 struct work_struct work;
905 struct drm_crtc *crtc;
906 struct drm_framebuffer *old_fb;
907 struct drm_i915_gem_object *pending_flip_obj;
908 struct drm_pending_vblank_event *event;
909 atomic_t pending;
910#define INTEL_FLIP_INACTIVE 0
911#define INTEL_FLIP_PENDING 1
912#define INTEL_FLIP_COMPLETE 2
913 u32 flip_count;
914 u32 gtt_offset;
915 struct drm_i915_gem_request *flip_queued_req;
916 u32 flip_queued_vblank;
917 u32 flip_ready_vblank;
918 bool enable_stall_check;
919};

934enc_to_dig_port(struct drm_encoder *encoder)

948}

951dp_to_dig_port(struct intel_dp *intel_dp)
952{

954}

956static inline struct intel_digital_port *
957hdmi_to_dig_port(struct intel_hdmi *intel_hdmi)
958{
959 return container_of(intel_hdmi, struct intel_digital_port, hdmi);
960}

962/*
963 * Returns the number of planes for this pipe, ie the number of sprites + 1
964 * (primary plane). This doesn't count the cursor plane then.
965 */
966static inline unsigned int intel_num_planes(struct intel_crtc *crtc)
967{
968 return INTEL_INFO(crtc->base.dev)->num_sprites[crtc->pipe] + 1;
969}

1496
1497static inline struct intel_crtc_state *
1498intel_atomic_get_crtc_state(struct drm_atomic_state *state,
1499 struct intel_crtc *crtc)
1500{
1501 struct drm_crtc_state *crtc_state;
1502 crtc_state = drm_atomic_get_crtc_state(state, &crtc->base);
1503 if (IS_ERR(crtc_state))
1504 return ERR_CAST(crtc_state);
1505
1506 return to_intel_crtc_state(crtc_state);
1507}

1509 struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc,
1510 struct intel_crtc_state *crtc_state);
